title: How to Change the Windows 10 Default from Wordpad to Word

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings. Press Win + I on your keyboard to open the Settings window. Alternatively, you can click the gear icon in the Start menu.

steps.title: Click Apps.
steps.content: Click Apps . It's next to a list icon. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Default Apps.
steps.content: Click Default Apps . You'll see this menu option in the menu on the left side of the window next to a list icon with an arrow on it. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Choose default apps by file type.
steps.content: Click Choose default apps by file type . This menu option is at the bottom of the menu under "Reset." [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source You'll see file types listed on the left side of the window next to the default app used to open them.

steps.title: Change the app next to ".
steps.content: Change the app next to ". docx, .rtf, and .txt" to Word. If the default is WordPad, click it, then select Word from the drop-down list. If you don't have an active Microsoft 365 subscription, you'll see a prompt to open the store. If there's no default listed, click Choose a default and select Word from the list.
